intro: Lipophragma eunomioides, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by edible, fleshy berries. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
